Pre-Game Insights: Mayank Yadav is expected to showcase his speed in the series against Bangladesh, providing an opportunity for fringe players.
Mayank Yadav has been fast-tracked into the side due to his special talent despite a side strain earlier in the year.
The series will test Mayank Yadav's fitness and temperament.
Harshit Rana and Nitish Kumar could make their India debut during the series.
Shubman Gill, Rishabh Pant, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Mohammed Siraj, and Axar Patel have been rested from the T20s against Bangladesh.
Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya are the two big names in the squad.
Abhishek Sharma has an opportunity to build his credentials following a hundred in Zimbabwe.
Sanju Samson could open alongside Abhishek Sharma in the series-opener.
Riyan Parag has another chance to make a strong impact after six T20s since July.
Varun Chakaravarthy makes a comeback after his international career was halted following the 2021 T20 World Cup.
Jitesh Sharma, picked as the reserve wicket-keeper, is desperate to get a game.
The series will serve as an audition for the four T20s in South Africa next month.
The series will provide IPL franchises more clarity on the Indian players they want to retain ahead of the mega auction.
Bangladesh will have to plan life without Shakib Al Hasan, who recently retired from Tests and T20s.
Off-spinner Mehidy Hasan Miraz has been recalled to the Bangladesh side after 14 months.
Veteran batter Mahmud Ullah stands at the crossroads of his career and a productive series might motivate him to continue.
Miscellaneous Highlights: International cricket returns to Gwalior after 14 years.
Shrimant Madhavrao Scindia Stadium will make its international debut on October 6, 2024.
A wall on the periphery of the stadium had caved in last month following heavy rains but has been repaired.
Captain Roop Singh Stadium in Gwalior hosted its last international match in 2010 when Sachin Tendulkar scored a double hundred.
